title: Former WPP boss Sir Martin Sorrell buys £13m of shares in S4 Capital
text:
Sir Martin Sorrell bought 9m shares in his agency S4 Capital for almost £13m

Sir Martin Sorrell has spent almost £13million buying 9m shares in his agency S4 Capital.

The advertising tycoon snapped up the stock as the company issued 101m new shares, worth £100million, to fund its purchase of Silicon Valley digital marketing firm Firewood.

Sorrell, 74, started S4 in May after quitting media agency WPP following allegations, which he denies, that he used corporate funds for prostitutes.

He has a 12.7 per cent stake in S4 worth £98million.

S4 intends to merge Firewood with its creative production arm Mediamonks, which makes websites, games and films for advertising firms.

The takeover will give S4 access to a client list that includes Facebook, Google and Linkedin.
